channel.title: Drawing on Jesse Manschot
channel.description: Recent content in Drawing on Jesse Manschot

item.title: This way
item.description: An illustration conveying a child’s dream, as strange as those can be. I wanted the owl to be slightly terrifying, but also fearfull of the boy. And part of the environment, as if it’s hiding there for a long while. This time I spent some more time refining the watercolor underlayer; instead of opting for one color I added some nuances in the way the light reveals certain yellows, while keeping the shadows warm and dark.

item.title: Stuck in Eternity
item.description: I wanted to bring the world of my recent drawings to life, so I decided to make a single scene with some animated elements in it, looping endlessly. The goal was to convey a sense of time standing still, or being ‘stuck in eternity’. First I made a couple of thumbnails and notan sketches of the image I had in my head, to get a feeling of the atmosphere. I then transfered to drawing on A3 sized paper.

item.title: Old Friends
item.description: I bought some new paper and grabbed a 2B pencil to draw this one. The 4B in my previous drawings tends to smudge a lot and it’s hard to draw details with the relatively soft graphite point. The scenery in this drawing is based on some old ruins of a little factory in an area I occasionally walk in. I imagined a small mechanical critter living there that is friendly towards an old man who frequents the sight.

item.title: Butterfly
item.description: Another drawing made with a 4B pencil. All coloring was done digitally. Initial thumbnailing Initial thumbnailing Pencil drawing Pencil drawing Final colored illustration Final colored illustration

item.title: Imagine a Sandcastle
item.description: The sandcastle always intrigued me: a structure made out of material (sand) which inherently crumbles quickly over time. Yet as a child, one can imagine entire worlds inside such a simple form – during such an objectively short amount of time. This is a little ode to that sentiment. Pencil drawing Pencil drawing Final colored illustration Final colored illustration

item.title: Yo-yo
item.description: I sketched the main character from the character design workshop I attended last month and decided to create a little illustration from it. The colours and shapes in the background were made digitally. I took some inspiration from abstract block prints as well as Koji Morimoto’s crazy drawings in terms of the usage of colour, but I was cautious not to overdo it. Initial sketch Initial sketch Final illustration Final illustration

item.title: Empty Marker Doodles
item.description: A selection of drawings made with the last ink left in a stylefile marker. Pencil colors, calligraphy brush and pilot pen lines added on top for details.

item.title: Character Design Workshop: Module 1
item.description: Last month I participated in an online character design workshop, taught by Anne Hoberg. It consisted of two modules; design principles and acting & posing. In the first module we got to learn all about how to construct appealing characters and breaking it down into basic design principles. We were assigned homework to finish three characters: a protagonist, sidekick and antagonist. I quickly got stuck when I tried to draw the characters out of nothing, directly onto the paper.

item.title: River bank Impression
item.description: Another impression, this time of a river bank…

item.title: Two Moor Impressions
item.description: I went on a long walk through forests and across moors…

item.title: Watercolour Weekend
item.description: Some watercolour sketches of mental imagery made during the weekend.
